content.description: A little height dependent getting to good holds through and over the large hueco.
content.location: Opposite of Vagination Alcove and slightly to the right while facing that wall.

content.description: This is the hard slab route just to the left of the first two routes encountered when entering the shady corridor on the west side wall.  The route starts up the easy slabby ledge to a short vertical section which is most easily ascended just right of the bolt at the lip.  From there, continue up slab that gets more and more difficult until the crux is encountered just before the last bolt when going the the obvious big chalked jug to your left with nothing at all for your left foot.  Luckily, the climb has key pockets throughout it making it possible, though the pockets aren't generally useful for straight down pulling.
content.protection: black painted glue in bolts to webbing anchor at the top of the wall (not visible from the ground).
content.location: Third route from the left on the west side of the corridor.

content.description: This is the obvious crack leading to a short juggy 2-bolt face and anchors.  The crux is the center portion of the crack before you get to the first bolt, so it may be a good idea to bring a piece of gear or two if this is anywhere near your limit, or just bring a long stick clip to clip past the crack.  Once you get to the bolted section the route is super easy to the chains.
content.protection: Small gear for the crack, 2 bolts and a bolted anchor.
content.location: This route is on the left (east) side of the shady corridor and is the first route on the main wall (not counting the detached pillar just north of the main wall).

content.description: This ascends the obvious arete on the edge of the first block on your left as you enter the shady corridor.  There are two cruxes, the first is getting off the ground and through the initial big sandy hueco, and the second is working your way through the slopers just before the last bolt.  This route is pretty fun, though the sandiness of some of the holds detracts from the overall quality.  The route is bolted with what appear to be wave bolts, but the eyes of the bolts are recessed into the rock making having a quickdraw come unclipped from the bolt as you climb past it a real concern, so be careful.
content.location: This is the first route on your left as you enter the shady corridor.  There is a small detached block on the east side of the beginning of the corridor, this route ascends the obvious arete on that block.

content.description: Left leaning crack to ring anchors.
content.location: Walk around the first two routes in Lambs Knoll, following the trail into the "canyon." It's the obviously large crack.

content.description: Toprope with ring bolts on top.
content.location: The first route you come to in the Lambs Knoll area.

content.description: Moderate climbing to 3rd bolt with the crux going over it to a 4th bolt. Featured face with many false positive holds that make it the crux through this section.
content.protection: Four 4 3/4 inch stainless steel bolts/hangers to 2-bolt anchor with chains for cleaning.
content.location: Directly opposite of the Vagination Alcove. If you are standing with your back in the alcove, you are looking directly at Naturalamb on the opposite wall. To the left of the unrecorded 3 bolt route through the large hueco in the Shady Corridor.
Access by leading Swings Both Ways and then setting up the top rope. Shares anchors with Swings Both Ways; follows directly below anchors.

content.description: Not particularly challenging, but featureless rock and highly-spaced bolts make this climb much harder and sketchier than the commonly-accepted grade of 5.7 would imply. Stick clipping the first bolt is highly recommended.
content.protection: 3 bolts to anchors (glue-ins with some old nylon webbing and a quicklink as of April 2023)
content.location: As soon as you step up the last big rock into the Shady Corridor, look up and right for glue-ins. The third bolt is inside the lip near the top of the wall.

content.description: Look for the huge Petzl glue-ins. Leads up smears and underclings to ring anchors.
content.location: Directly across from the Mutton Block.

content.description: Scramble over a big rock step to enter the Shady Corridor (which typically lives up to its name despite the picture!). The routes are arranged in a way that makes it hard to list in left-to-right order; Made in the Shade and Sunnyside Up are on your right as you enter, Unknown Arete 5.10+ to your left.
